actions.text: Referred to House Committee on House Administration.
Reported to House from the Committee on House Administration with amendment, H. Rept. 96-42.
Measure called up as privileged matter in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #54 (257-138).

official_title: A resolution to provide funds for the expenses of studies and investigations to be conducted by the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on House Administration with amendment, H. Rept. 96-42) Authorizes expenditures, not to exceed $1,200,000, by the House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs for studies and investigations. Prohibits any part of such funds from expenditure in connection with the study of any subject being investigated for the same purpose by any other House committee. Terminates the authorization granted by this resolution on January 3, 1980.

titles.title: A resolution to provide funds for the expenses of studies and investigations to be conducted by the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
